topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540001f9636872035fe30000#post_540001f9636872035fe30000
Oh the irony! XD

Honestly I love Phoenix Wright but I have never played any of the games and every time, _*everytime*_, I try to watch a walkthrough I end up forgetting to continue or I find something else to watch and it makes me mad because I know the Ace Attorney games are good!

It's just that they require a lot of reading and some of the walkthrouers go through the text really fast or I read to slow. 

~^And I guess I should blame my low attention span as well I suppose.^~

But by all means, play the games! like I said, I _know_ their good!
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5400056c6368720821e30100#post_5400056c6368720821e30100

Motion capture is getting more common with time, so whose to say the next Ace Attorney wont't be like that?

The conflict might be with the more over the top scenes in the game, but I dn't think they can't be worked and tweeked if given the chance.

I would play it if wright gets to hijack cars, and go MvC3 on someone.

NIGHT N1!

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54004e7e636872702a0a0300#post_54004e7e636872702a0a0300
I think so. (I thought he could get bigger than that, But I think I was wrong.)

Anyway, How durable is he? And Can he absorb energy based attacks? (If he isn't durable enough, The Eye slugger can finish him off pretty quickly, If he can't absorb energy, He probably won't be able to survive the Wide shot.)

I'm not sure how sharp the Slugger is, But I do know that the Only things it failed to cut through are the robots.
